meanings.sent1: The party had a fancified cake with colorful decorations.
meanings.sent2: She wore a fancified dress to the special event.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked fancified in its tiny bow tie.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a fancified paradise with blooming flowers everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The room was fancified with sparkling lights and elegant curtains.

meanings.definition: To make something more decorative or ornate
meanings.sent1: She fancified the gift with a shiny bow.
meanings.sent2: He fancified the living room by adding new paintings.
meanings.sent3: The chef fancified the dish by adding edible flowers.
meanings.sent4: The artist fancified the mural with intricate details.
meanings.sent5: They fancified the garden by planting exotic flowers.

meanings.definition: To embellish or enhance in a showy or extravagant way
meanings.sent1: The designer fancified the dress with sequins and beads.
meanings.sent2: They fancified the car with custom paint and rims.
meanings.sent3: The magician fancified the trick with colorful scarves.
meanings.sent4: The chef fancified the dessert with a flaming presentation.
meanings.sent5: The singer fancified the performance with elaborate costumes.
